item.title: Triton Compiler Development Tips
item.description: Triton provides an elegant solution to program GPU kernels in Python, positioning itself as a critical component in the modern AI software stack. To deliver performance and portability, it leverages a compiler, the capability of which determines the potential. Hacking the compiler internals is not a simple task. Here are some tips hopefully useful to folks. I’ll try to keep this blog post updated periodically.

item.title: Sampling Performance Counters from Mobile GPU Drivers
item.description: In a previous blog post I gave a general introduction to GPU driver internals in Android/Linux systems. Following up with it, today I will explain how a specific functionality, hardware performance counter (perf counter) queries, is handled in both Qualcomm Adreno and ARM Mali drivers, by walking through the kernel driver source code.
